Grouped_Utterances: Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay. I actually applied for that job we talked about!

It was nerve-wracking, but I felt proud of myself for doing it. I was really anxious leading up to it, though. Not yet. I’m trying not to dwell on it too much, but it’s hard. I think I feel a bit more hopeful, but I also have moments of doubt. I try to remind myself that I took a step forward. It’s just hard to silence that voice that says I’m not good enough. I’ll keep that in mind. I’m trying to focus on the positives.
I feel more relaxed and less anxious afterward. It’s nice to get some fresh air.

I’ve been distracting myself with more horror movies and music. It helps take my mind off things. I’ve been going for walks in the park. It helps clear my head. Well, I applied for a job, I’m taking care of myself, and I’ve been enjoying my walks.
I think I’m good for now. I feel like I’ve made some progress.
I kept reminding myself of the affirmation we talked about. It really helped me focus. I’ve been trying to do that. I’ll tell myself that it’s okay to feel this way and that I’m doing my best.
I’d like to! Maybe I can make it a weekly thing to go and sit by the pond. I think I can do that. It sounds nice.
